instructions:
In a small bowl mix the wine and tomato paste until smooth. Stir in the remaining sauce ingredients and
set aside.
Place cut ribs in a pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil then lower heat to a simmer. Skim off any
foam, then cover and simmer *(low/warm)* for 2 hours. Remove ribs from water and place on paper towels to
drain.
Place ribs in a Pamed shallow Pyrex baking dish or pan in a single layer, and lightly brush ribs with
melted bacon drippings. Bake in a 350 F oven for 10 minutes, turning at 5 minutes. Then baste ribs with
above sauce and return to oven for another 5 minutes, then turn and baste with sauce for final 5 minutes.
Serves 4. Have damp napkins available. 
*(Rev. 8/12/97)*.
ingredients: 2 lbs pork spare ribs, cut between bones
name: Chinese Style Barbecued Ribs
